Feedback
To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the &applet; applet or this manual, follow the directions in the GNOME Feedback Page.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &applet; applet displays an animated image in a panel.
To add &applet; to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose Add to Panel Amusements Fish .

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Click on the applet to display the Wanda the Fish dialog. The dialog typically displays a fortune cookie. You can configure the applet to specify the command to run when you click on the applet. See for more information.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: To configure &applet;, right-click on the &applet; applet, then choose Preferences.

listitem.para: Use this text box to specify the name of the fish.
Use this field to select the image to display in the applet. You can select an image that is supplied with the applet or a personal image.

term.guilabel: Command to execute when fish is clicked

listitem.para: By default, &applet; runs the fortune command when you click on the applet. Use this text box to specify an alternative command to run.
Use this spin box to specify the number of frames in the animation.
Use this spin box to specify the pause in seconds between each frame in the animation.
Select this option to rotate the applet image when you add the applet to a vertical panel.
